snippet: The company reported that its revenue dropped 7 percent in the most recent quarter as it has struggled to compete in the online retail and e-book market.
abstract: Barnes & Noble reports smaller first-quarter loss, but struggling retailer could not avoid 7 percent sales decline as it tries to compete in online retail and e-book market; reports revenue of $1.23 billion, down from $1.33 billion in the same period a year ago; company had net loss of $28.4 million, or 56 cents a share.
lead_paragraph: The company reported that its revenue dropped 7 percent in the most recent quarter as it has struggled to compete in the online retail and e-book market.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Revenue Is Off, but Loss Narrows
